name: Big Data Tools
description:
With this plugin, you can conveniently work with Zeppelin notebooks, monitor Spark and Hadoop applications, and preview AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Minio, Linode, Digital Open Space, Microsoft Azure, and Hadoop Distributed File System files right from IntelliJ-based IDEs including IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate, PyCharm Professional, and DataGrip.


For Zeppelin notebooks written in Scala, the plugin offers smart navigation, code completion, inspections & quick-fixes, and refactorings inside the notebooks. You can browse, create, and run Zeppelin notebooks without leaving the IDE. If your Zeppelin server is using a Spark cluster, or you configured a Spark cluster separately in the plugin settings, the plugin will allow you to track Spark jobs, see cluster environment and storage information from the IDE. With ZTools, you can view details of the variables as you execute your notebooks, and can get smart completion for data frame columns in SQL and Scala.


You can also upload, download, and preview large structured files in tabular form, including CVS, Parquet, AVRO, and ORC formats.
notes:
New features

  • Support for Zeppelin 0.9
  • Ability to import and export Zeppelin notes
  • Settings for Zeppelin interpreters and repositories
  • Code insight for zeppelin.<ClassName>.precode
  • New option in the Spark Submit Run Configuration: ability to run a custom script before the submit
  • Improvements for PySpark builtins resolve
  • Better configuration of Python dependencies and Python SDK in notes
  • New feedback options and the feedback button in the BDT tool window
  • Ability to discover Zeppelin notes using the IDE file search mechanism

Bug fixes

  • Allowed to set multiple configuration values using Spark Configuration / Properties List
  • No more flickering while typing in Zeppelin notes
  • Improved code completion in Zeppelin notes for SQL when ZTools is enabled
  • Better displaying of table data in a note output
  • Improved workflows for Zeppelin local notes
  • Zeppelin actions `Run All Above`/`Run All Below` change their behavior in case of any errors during cell execution
  • Zeppelin “Setup SDK” button works properly
  • Improved appearance of charts in Zeppelin note outputs
  • Fixed an exception in Azure on testing connection with invalid credentials
  • A folder name in Azure can now have a trailing dot symbol
  • The merge operation is performed when overwriting folders on HDFS
  • No more exceptions in Spark Monitoring when disabling connections
  • The SQL tab in Spark Monitoring is properly displayed for Spark v3.0.1
  • Improved preview of CSV files
  • Fixed copying notes from a Zeppelin server to the local file system

Minor changes

  • Ability to restart interpreters for a particular paragraph right from the gutter or editor context menu
  • A Spark Monitoring configuration is per project if a Zeppelin connection is per project
  • Optimized refresh of connections to remote file systems and Zeppelin servers
  • Improved icons for Minio and Linode
  • The Zeppelin `Interpreter Bindings` window now preserves size and position
  • Changed background color for the note full-text search in the dark theme
  • Ability to copy a note URL to the clipboard

The full release notes are available here.
